704348f-b.title: Brooklyn: Flatbush Avenue - Lafayette Street
704348f-b.text:
Flatbush Avenue Extension, east side, between Lafayette Street
and Debevoise Place, showing a triengular plot occupiec by a
gasoline station and a few old rookeries. On the right is the
Paramount Theatre building. On the left is an old tenemeat at
the southeast corner of Lafayette and Debevoise, also showa.
in view 2.
P. L. Sperr  August :3, 1939
NO PEPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2

706663f-a.title: Brooklyn: Schermerhorn Street - Flatbush Avenue
706663f-a.text:
Schermerhorn Street, south side, between Flatbush
and Third Avenues, showing the building of the Young
Women's Christian Associatior, the view being across
Temple Square. The building was later put up for sale
by the Charles F. Noyes Company.
About 1925
L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

704349f-b.title: Brooklyn: Flatbush Avenue - Lafayette Street
704349f-b.text:
Flatbush A enue Extension, east side, from Lafayette
Street(left) to Debevoise Place, showing several old rookeries
and gasolie stations. On the extreme right is a portion of
the Paramount Theatre Building; the 4-story house on the left
is on Safayette Street and Debevoise Place.
April 7, 1932
P. L. Sperr
NuO REPRODI:TIONS
(2)
The same location, at a later date. The two upper
stories of the 2appa Brothers gas station were removed; the
other rookeries remaining intact, except for the change of
tenants.
April 27, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODICTIONS
(3)
The same block, viewing from Debevoise Place to Lafayette
Street. Debevoise Place is on the extreme rig ht rnd forms a
forty-five degree angle with Flatbush Avenue. Beyond the Par-
amount Bowling Center is the four-story tenement seen on the
left in view 1. Shown,too,is the factory of the Edison Screw
Machine Products Company, also known as the Maltz Building.
April 27, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NvO REPRODICTIONS
Ng ' 21
704349f-b.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Lafayette Street, Brooklyn, NY
